segment.source: Applications Node
segment.target: Applications Node

segment.source: Applications Node
segment.target: Applications Node

segment.source: Applications Node
segment.target: Applications Node

segment.source: The Applications node is one level below the Application Virtualization node in the Scope pane of the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.
segment.target: The Applications node is one level below the Application Virtualization node in the Scope pane of the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.

segment.source: When you select this node, the Results pane displays a list of applications.
segment.target: When you select this node, the Results pane displays a list of applications.

segment.source: Right-click the Applications node to display a pop-up menu that contains the following elements.
segment.target: Right-click the Applications node to display a pop-up menu that contains the following elements.

segment.source: New Application
segment.target: New Application

segment.source: This menu item displays the New Application Wizard.
segment.target: This menu item displays the New Application Wizard.

segment.source: This wizard consists of one page where you can select an icon for the application and browse to or enter a URL or a path to the Open Software Descriptor (OSD) file.
segment.target: This wizard consists of one page where you can select an icon for the application and browse to or enter a URL or a path to the Open Software Descriptor (OSD) file.

segment.source: Change Icon—Displays a standard Windows icon browser.
segment.target: Change Icon—Displays a standard Windows icon browser.

segment.source: Browse to and select the desired icon.
segment.target: Browse to and select the desired icon.

segment.source: OSD File Path or URL—Enter a local absolute path, a full Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path, or an HTTP URL.
segment.target: OSD File Path or URL—Enter a local absolute path, a full Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path, or an HTTP URL.

segment.source: ... (OSD browse button)—Displays the standard Windows Open File dialog box.
segment.target: ... (OSD browse button)—Displays the standard Windows Open File dialog box.

segment.source: Browse to find the desired file.
segment.target: Browse to find the desired file.

segment.source: New Window from Here
segment.target: New Window from Here

segment.source: Select this menu item to open a new management console with the selected node as the root node.
segment.target: Select this menu item to open a new management console with the selected node as the root node.

segment.source: Export List
segment.target: Export List

segment.source: You can use this menu item to create a tab-delimited text file that contains the contents of the Results pane.
segment.target: You can use this menu item to create a tab-delimited text file that contains the contents of the Results pane.

segment.source: This item displays a standard File Save dialog box where you specify the location for the text file you are creating.
segment.target: This item displays a standard File Save dialog box where you specify the location for the text file you are creating.

segment.source: View
segment.target: View

segment.source: This pop-up list of menu items enables you to change the appearance and content of the Results pane.
segment.target: This pop-up list of menu items enables you to change the appearance and content of the Results pane.

segment.source: Refresh
segment.target: Refresh

segment.source: Select this item to refresh the management console.
segment.target: Select this item to refresh the management console.

segment.source: Help
segment.target: Help

segment.source: This item displays the help system for the management console.
segment.target: This item displays the help system for the management console.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Applications Results Pane
segment.target: Applications Results Pane

segment.target: Applications Results Pane Columns
